intro: Lipotriche pungens, commonly known as the spiny poinsettia, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy bracts that resemble leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Lipotriche pungens is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant foliage and seasonal color changes.
